website_summaries.verdict: We give it high marks for its floor space and breathable mesh windows. It might not suffice for camping in rough terrain.
pros: Excellent ventilation, plenty of space, and easy to set up
cons: Only one door can make it awkward for multiple campers
Less headroom than some other models

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE... I went on a 48 state 96 day tour, mostly camping. It was easy to set up and take down. Kept me nice in dry in some pretty nasty weather.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Blum

customer_reviews.title: Tent poles difficult to get into pockets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in late summer of 2016, but only got to use it for the first time last month. It did hold up pretty well in rainy weather with only a little water coming in through the seams. I did add additional waterproofing before I went camping with it. However, I had a problem like some of of the other reviewers where the tent was extraordinarily difficult to put together. It appeared the poles were too long for the tent, and it took three people, struggling, to get them in the pockets. I exchanged it for another tent from Wenzel. They provided excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: NICE TENT
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this tent it stormed. I never got the chance to spray the tent with waterproofer, so I was worried. This tent stood up to the rain pretty well. The side walls felt a little damp when I touched them, but no drips and no water on the floor. Tent is small but not too small. I'm a big guy. It should be perfect for 2 peeps. Setting up alone is a little tough. And the poles require some muscle to bend and stick in the sockets. But once set up, it's strong and sturdy. I'm trying to find some cons, but for the price, there really aren't any.
customer_reviews.author: NICESITH

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tent as a backpacking tent for the wife and I on a 5 night trip. Day two the shock cord became detached internally from the end of the pole which is glued shut. Reached out to Wenzel who just gave me a run around and a link to REI for repair. So much for a 10 year warranty or standing behind a product from manufacturer defects. I'd return the thing if I hadn't waited so long to use it and still could. Save your money and buy something of the same quality from Walmart at half the price at least then you know what your getting.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst tent I've ever had. Sleeps 3? Only if its 3 small kids. It rained on us the first night we used it in the mountains and it leaked everywhere. We where soaked and so was everything we had in the tent with us... If I could give it less than 1 star I would. Don't buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Fit me and my roommate who's 6ft comfortable with room to spare. About 6 inches on either side of him when he laid on the floor. Also fits a queen sized air mattress awkwardly but fits! Great ventilation with the mesh windows. Would definitely buy again. We used this on a day where it was slightly cloudy in a shaded area that had a lot of fog and dew in the morning so the inside had condensation even with a tarp under the tent but nothing to bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dru

customer_reviews.title: 3 Person tent?
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not a 3 person tent for adults to stay in comfortably, maybe 3 kids yeah sure but not adults, other than that it really is a great tent. This is my first tent ever and I have to say its super easy to setup and straight forward I'm able to fit a queen size air mattress inside of with it with room for another person and my stuff.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Survived rain storm mid music festival
customer_reviews.text: Loved this tent!! My sister and I used it during a music festival, there was a HUGE rain storm. I had been dancing the whole day so my sister couldn’t wake me up to get us to safety, I slept through the whole thing with little to no water in the tent!! If you’re thinking of using this tent with three people it may be a bit of a squeeze though. My sister and I fit in there comfortably along with both of our backpacks which took up the rest of the room, overall love it!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: SMALL
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for camping with my sister it is definitely NOT a three person tent, it would be comfortable for one person and maybe a duffel bag and small dog..we fit barely together with sleeping pads and sleeping bags and are touching the side of the tent which leads to water leaking in.....it will work for now but I would NOT recommend this for more then one person. (I believe the shape of the tent effects this) It also isn't very water resistant had to put two coats of water proofer on not just the seems but the walls as well, and its still prone to leak puddles under the windows....not a horrible tent just not what we thought
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, 3 season starter tent for the price. Keeps you dry, keeps you out of the elements.
customer_reviews.text: If you just want a tent for average, every day camping, this one is hard to be beat for the price. Easy to setup - I can do it alone in 5-10 minutes. Effective - I haven't tested it in a driving rain storm, but very few tents will withstand continuous downpour. This one, for $50, will keep you dry in a light rain, and withstands the wind very well. It also breathes well, making it an excellent tent nearly year round for the southern US. I've used it 75 degrees and I've used it in 30 degrees. Works fine as a tent either way.
customer_reviews.author: AvidConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent
customer_reviews.text: THis tent is just flat out awesome... Not good with a queen size mattress hoewever unless it is very thin..I bought a real tall queen and although it works fine it is a bit cramped and the zipper is tough to close, I suggest a full size mattress or a thin one and life will be good in this awesome well constructed quality tent
customer_reviews.author: Edp986

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience!
customer_reviews.text: My adult son bought this tent for a weekend music festival and had a difficult time setting it up by himself. Once he got it set up, it started raining and the tent flooded due to leaks in the seams, so it totally ruined his weekend. We returned it!
customer_reviews.author: Donni

customer_reviews.title: Wenzel buyer for life
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent almost 5 years ago for a month long camping trip and have been using it for weekend trips ever since. It worked out super well for us, easy to put up and take down with a good amount of inside space. The part that brings me here to leave this review was our most recent camping trip last week in Minnesota. This monster storm came through while we were away from our campsite. When we returned we had no idea what to expect... but it was fine, standing, sealed and dry. My mind was blown. Wont be buying any other brand of tent from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this in multiple environments. Up in the mountains, at the Grand Canyon, in the woods... It's definitely small. I would not attempt to put more than two people who are very comfortable with each other in it. However, my fiance and I once slept in it with two small dogs and two cats when we were on the road and it was okay. It's pretty durable and while you can't stand up in it it's very good for the price. As far as setting it up, it's fairly easy. It might require some strength to put the poles in their slots, but once they're in the material will stretch so they're easier to put in next time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Heinbokel

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Good tent, but the rain tarp in very small and it gets condensation on the inside when there’s foggy moist air/ weather. But rain proof, on light non windy weather. It’s sturdy and easy to set up and take down, the only suggestion I would make is buying some metal stakes because they come with basic plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: AStavros

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what a tent should do.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve spent five nights in the tent in torential downpour, I stayed dry. Easy set up and disassembly makes it a breeze to be in and out. Only major critique is that the tent is tiny. It says three person, but it can not fit a full sized air mattress, my twin sized took up about 60% of the tents floor.
customer_reviews.author: huh?

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper in store
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these for camping, fast shipping but found them cheaper in the store. Update: We used them, they leaked, its suppose to be a 3 man tent, nope it was a 2 man tent. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: stacey

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is small yet spacious. The three pole design was easy to put up. The rain fly was kinda confusing at first but once on it gives complete coverage of netted roof. The two Windows zip open for ventilation nice no see'um screening. The door is a D shape and has the same window configuration as the side windows. The incorporated little vestibule and floor mat are very nice. It has a cargo net to hold small items as well as a a ring to hang a small lantern. Overall we are stoked on this tent and can't wait to get on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Good tent, but disappointed that the tent long pole cracked during the assembling process due to unclear instructions and constantly correcting positioning. Now I need to replace pole because my son was so excited and I didn't want to to return it. Can the company send me a replacement long pole?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars for the impossible set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for my sons first camping trip. The assembly was ok-until you reached the pole at the top. That sucker was near impossible to put in where it was supposed to go. Even adding the top pole first-I still struggled to make it fit. The kids loved the tent, the assembly was hell.
customer_reviews.author: Shanda Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Not a winter tent but ....
customer_reviews.text: NOT A WINTER TENT! The roof vent, even when covered with the fly cover, still allows for cold, draftiness and air to enter and does not allow for warm air to stay in the tent. Other than that complaint, excellent overall tent. Easy to put up with 3 total poles. Very spacious inside for 2 people. We added a 6 year old child and it was a tight fit with the gear inside also. Love the storage pockets, upper net that holds lights and keys and phone, well constructed zippers and we experienced 50 mph winds and rain and it held up like a champ....just bitterly cold though and that was with a heater inside the tent!!
customer_reviews.author: michael altan

customer_reviews.title: This tent really only fits 2 people comfortably (uncomfortably if you have a queen size blowup mattress)
customer_reviews.text: This tent really only fits 2 people comfortably (uncomfortably if you have a queen size blowup mattress), but this thing saved us from a camping DISASTER where everyone everyone else's tents were flooded, but ours remained unscathed. Could it have been the extra tarp we put over it? Or the fact that we set up on an incline? Perhaps. But I'll give credit where I still feel it's due. Also, relatively easy to assemble and lightweight to carry. Would recommend this tent to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Murdertramppp

customer_reviews.title: Some notes
customer_reviews.text: Its only eight feet by eight feet at the farthest points, if you are 6 feet tall then you will be in here by yourself i hope, sleeping diagonally. Definitely only a two person tent. They always picture no luggage and everyone sleeping cramped in mummy bags, unless thats the case, expect to fit two people. The poles are a bit difficult to get into the slots. The "outside storage area" created by the overhanging is not even enough for a pair of shoes, don't be fooled. Overall though it is a decent tent, lucky i knew about tents before hand and could expect some of these issues. It came with no tears or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Zingbo43

customer_reviews.title: SMALL!!
customer_reviews.text: Super small inside! I read on one review that it will fit a queen sized air mattress!! I had to stuff the mattress in!! I had barely any additional room left once the mattress was in!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: The tent is big enough for 2 people to fit comfortably. ( As in, I hope you know the other person well ) If you try to fit 3 people in it, I hope you know the other two VERY well. I fit a twin size mattress in it fine, but I'm pretty sure a queen size would fit too. It rained while I was using it, and there was no leaks. Compact and light, great for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: The Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, but...
customer_reviews.text: After receiving this tent, I set it up in the yard to make sure I could do it in the dark, in the woods, prior to an upcoming trip. I'm glad I did as the tent stakes provided were weak and useless. The thin metal rods bend easily and the loops they go through on the tent have very small openings. I ended up buying metal stakes that were similar to very large nails that would still go through the loops. Having said all that, the rest of the tent seems fine and I'll confirm its performance on that camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: JBinAZ

customer_reviews.title: A decent entry-level tent.
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: it does the trick for a good price. It's spacious (like most tents, 3 "person" means 2 adults or several kids) and sets up easy. It's light and packs pretty small. It's CHEAP, so I found it to be a steal for casual camping with the kids. The complaints others have had do appear, but they're not show-stoppers: the tent doesn't breath very well with the fly on and you should probably use a water-proofing spray on the seams. Overall, though, it's a wonderful entry-level tent.
customer_reviews.author: Spacecataz

customer_reviews.title: otherwise good quality and
customer_reviews.text: tents always say they fit a certain number of people but with luggage, they'll only fit half the number. this was spacious enough for 2 people plus some luggage, but wish tent makers would account for people actually bringing stuff camping! otherwise good quality and price
customer_reviews.author: T. W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent, stays dry.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for an outdoor country music festival. And it rained... a lot... but my tent stayed dry!! Fit 3 people, but meant for 2. I’ve fit 4 before, but I’d only recommend that if you like to snuggle. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent was very roomy since I shared it with one other person. I was able to fit a queen size air mattress in it without trouble, though one of the corners was pressing against the wall since the tent has a pentagon shape. The set up of the tent was simple but a little frustrating because my friend and I had to really push the poles hard to get it into the little pockets at the bottom corners of the tent. If you work out regularly, I'm sure you would have no problem, but us runts have trouble with work requiring muscle. Taking the tent down and putting it away was a breeze, though!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: A great pop up tent for outdoor camping.
customer_reviews.text: Camping with family. It’s a great tent for 2 people 3 if you don’t mind sleeping very close. Easy to assemble and the pop-up is the truth it just pops up make sure you bring a rubber hammer Do you fasten it to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Catina Gallaspy

customer_reviews.title: First time camper
customer_reviews.text: Read instructions before trying to put it together. Easy to set up just got stuck at the end and that's when instruction state for someone to stand inside a slight push tent up while someone tries to put pole in hole...it worked and we were done. Easy to collapse too.. No puddle in the inside corners, minimal water came through flooring & I only notice rain drops coming through bottom grey part of tent but I still feel it's good.
customer_reviews.author: ***ana

customer_reviews.title: Im disappointed with it actually
customer_reviews.text: Its too small for me, no way 3 people are sleeping in this tent, once i put my bed in there, and my little bag of cloths there is absolutely no room at all. And it is low. Had a hard time crawling in and out of it. I had a real hard time putting it up also, poles in real tight had to have help, no way ill be able to put it up by myself. Im disappointed with it actually, i am going to have to try another one next year. It seems like a nice tent if you want a really small one.
customer_reviews.author: elora prettyman

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: Recently went camping on the beach here in Florida. The tent did an excellent job at protecting us (2 adults) from the elements. PROS: Gear-loft pretty good size for 2 adults entrance area ease of opening doors and windows. easy to breakdown and store. CONS: was a little stiff putting together for the first time wish the weather blind was a bit bigger I really liked the tent. we put a 8x10 tarp underneath the tent to prevent sticks from poking holes. Another tarp could have been used to prevent rain from entering, but it didn't rain so I'll edit this once I've used it in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Melhasan

customer_reviews.title: Not a 3 person tent but not a bad value either
customer_reviews.text: Not completely waterproof interior, and more like a one person tent.. unless the 3 people are small toddlers lol. But decent for the price and will serve your average single person well for brief camping excursions.
customer_reviews.author: Baylee Irina Betchkal

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: I camp out on the beach, Mustang island and Padre Island in Texas. This is a really good beach tent, the windows sealed up nice, the rain flap was tight and close to the top, allowing minimal sand in. It fit my queen size air mattress in, tight but it fit. I was impressed with how well it held up to wind, 25-30 mph sustained one day, same winds destroyed my brothers tent and my fathers shade tent. I will be buying another as a back-up. I have gone through a few tents in the last couple years looking for one that could hold up to the harsh conditions present while camping on a beach and this one did it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love it but it was just okay
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love it but it was just okay. We used it for just two people and what I thought was a big plus - the shape of the floor - ended up as one of the flaws. Our air mattress didn't fit well and we couldn't close the zipper when it was sticking out of one side. It was a bit too short and didn't feel so big and comfy on the inside. What I liked about it was the entrance way with the shoe place. I also liked the ceiling net where we put light, fan and small things. Very helpful "shelve". It's also light and easy to build.
customer_reviews.author: Mashav Shelef

customer_reviews.title: Tent has held up really good. It's easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I took this tent camping last weekend and it rained and the bottom stayed dry. Tent has held up really good. It's easy to put together. It takes a little effort the first time because everything is new and tight but afterwards it gets a lot easier. The shape is a little odd for three people. I put a full-size air mattress in it and it just fits with a little room on each side. So far it has been a really good tent and I have enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hooks

customer_reviews.title: Not a 3 person tent
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent. Very comfortable but Definitely not a three person tent it was just me and my 12-year-old daughter and we fit in it perfect no extra room at all. So if you need a 3 person tent, this isnt the tent for you
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rudloff

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed. It was not made correctly
customer_reviews.text: I sent it back. We could not make the support rods fit in the pockets. After extreme effort, no luck. Had to send it back. So disappointed. It was not made correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Tent
customer_reviews.text: My in-laws purchased this tent for our 6yr old son for his birthday. We are currently using it in the basement playroom, and he loves it. It went up pretty smoothly, although the tent poles were difficult to get into the end pockets (the length seems about an inch or so too long, so it is a struggle to put in). I have done a lot of camping and I have never had such a struggle to get the pole in the final pocket. It seems to be good quality. I like that there is a small overhang over the door. I believe it would sleep two comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how this tent was because no parts fit together and it was impossible to set up. My boyfriend and I spent an hour trying to figure it out and no luck. It ended up in the dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put up. I can do this by myself. It fits a queen blow up (although it is very snug). I like the little 'ceiling' netting you can put up to hold lightweight objects. It also has a built in loop in the center of the 'ceiling' to hang a lantern.
customer_reviews.author: cskodi

customer_reviews.title: Love Wenzel!
customer_reviews.text: It's the only brand we use because it is so durable and easy to assemble. And it stays dry!!!
customer_reviews.author: Maui, HI

customer_reviews.title: Cute tent but the hardest to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It was light weight but so difficult to assemble. It was also too small for three people, if anything, two fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: MuzikFan

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Completely ripped off. Poles were all broken meaning the connection wires that hold the poles were all broken. Had rip in tent.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: dont know how well it works
customer_reviews.text: it was damaged when I received the tent so I never used it I returned it & purchased a regular pup tent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its SMALL
customer_reviews.text: By looking at the specs and reviews you'd think it would be fine for 1 person 5'6", nope. specs are for exterior size, not internal. Single height twin air mattress is a tight fit no matter what direction you try. My head or feet touched at one end or the other. The door is very low, if you have back issues steer clear unless your in the market for a kids tent.
customer_reviews.author: James Winter

customer_reviews.title: Hard working tent
customer_reviews.text: Went on a road trip from Florida to Alaska and back. This tent was amazing. Held up through the thick and thin. Weathered the worst rain storm I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing while camping. Looking at the small fly sheet you wouldn't think it works work but it kept us dry through intense wind and rain. We are so happy with this tent. Easy to install and reliable plus affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Olive Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: The only piece of amazon camping gear that fully survived my trip.
customer_reviews.text: Wenzel’s has had a profound impact on my life. Before the week of August 5th, 2018 I was just a regular guy slogging my way through the daily travail we call life. Now I’m thinking abt moving out of my parents basement, getting that promotion to manager of my section at the video game store I work at, and maybe even starting to work on a high school diploma. Wenzels isn’t just a place to sleep. U enter as boy but exit a man
customer_reviews.author: joshua E.

customer_reviews.title: NOT big enough for 3 Adults!
customer_reviews.text: This tent comes with no instructions whatsoever, so you just have to put it together by looking at the picture...I finally got it together after several attempts The inside of the tent is NOT big enough for 3 average size adults, but could fit 3 small children or possible 1 adult and 2 small children.....3 adults would be sleeping right next to each other with their feet hitting the sides... Tent is OK for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice size tent for me and my big dog but ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice size tent for me and my big dog but very difficult to put up by myself. One of the poles broke the first time I used it so now I have to send it back. Wish that hadn't happened because otherwise the tent was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy M

customer_reviews.title: Easy easy easy
customer_reviews.text: Remember it’sa 3 person tent. I used a blow up couch And could only use half of it. Other than that I it was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne J.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to assemble, wish I would have tried puttting it together when I first got it as I 100% would have returned it. Weird pole in the back that makes pentagon shape I was never able to seat in the pocket and it was a struggle for my sons scout leader to get it. Fabric just doesn't stretch enough to seat it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good through all weather conditions
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ! It is a small tent as described but it does the job. I used it to go accross the country, I had all types of weather, from freezing, to burning hot, and going through heavy rain showers. It help up perfectly, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Marie-ange Brumelot

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I got this tent back in last year August for a camping music festival I went to in September. I had a guy friend camp with me and he is extremely tall, like 6"2 maybe. He slept straight on it without having to bend his legs or any part of his body, his two bags and my two bags fitted in there and it was still roomy. I made sure to pack it up when the festival was over to bring it back this year again.
customer_reviews.author: Eunice Larissa Montoya Berry

customer_reviews.title: Smaller, not 3 person.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good tent for the price! It's just a little smaller than we thought it would be. It says it's a 3 person tent but my husband and I are pretty small framed and we were only just comfortable. It rained the entire night and we had no leaks, so it's good to know it's durable. I really like the screened windows on each side.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Aside from that it was large enough for two people to fit easily with a bunch of gear
customer_reviews.text: This tent served me well on my camping trip in nearly every way. The only 'issue' I had was that it didn't breathe very well in the humid weather, and it ended up with quite a bit of condensation on the inside. Aside from that it was large enough for two people to fit easily with a bunch of gear, and assembled and broke down quickly.
customer_reviews.author: TheBeardedArtist

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to set up except for the short pole
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up except for the short pole, seems to be a little too long but after a lot of pulling and tugging we got it together. Very waterproof but not super breathable, you get a lot of condensation on the walls. Able to fit a queen size air mattress but not much more, I'd say it's more of a 2 person tent
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this thinking it would be a quick and easy tent to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be a quick and easy tent to set up, but it takes about 10 to 15 minutes and is pretty hard to set up. The stakes it came with are junk, so plan on getting bigger better stakes. The poles are very hard get in the little pockets and I think it will probably rip after a few more times, but we'll see. I like how compact it is when in its case and very lightweight. Looks good too. Probably wouldn't get another one like this one.
customer_reviews.author: John DeVaux

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put up.
customer_reviews.text: We just used it for the first time. The tent to good and worked as expected however it has one problem. The poles are very hard to get in. My husband and I get everything together but once we needed to bend the poles and slide them into place, we found the poles were about 3 cm longer than they should be. With a lot of work we were able to get the tent put up. If you do not have a second person and some strength, this is not the tent for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: though probably isn't the best for heavy rain and/or winds
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this tent for about two years now. After countless times putting it up and taking it back down there is still almost no visible wear. Its stood up to Moderate rain, though probably isn't the best for heavy rain and/or winds. Super easy to assemble and get back into the bag when you're done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: I am not sure that this tent fits 3 people ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure that this tent fits 3 people, maybe 3 children. Honestly it is very cute, I got it for my son to play in outside, but I cant say I would take this on an actual camping trip if I had to shove three people in this little thing, maybe for one adult, but not for 3.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Decent ten
customer_reviews.text: Tent is nice. Builds up quite a bit of condensation and let’s a bit of moisture in. Setting it up is a bit of a struggle even if you’re experienced in setting up tents, requires a good bit of strength to get the last pole in. Nice and roomy once set up and could fit two to three people comfortably
customer_reviews.author: Justin Smith

customer_reviews.title: it is such great quality! My favorite feature is the easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly for the price of this tent, it is such great quality! My favorite feature is the easy to use and sturdy zippers. There is no fabric flap that gets easily caught in the zipper as with traditional tents. It is easy to set up and light weight for a camping trip. I also love how the roof of the tent has a "shelf" where you can place a lantern, keys, or phone or anything important that you don't want to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Newbie Camper
customer_reviews.text: Able to erect according to instructions. You may need to purchase a mallet to put the stakes in the ground depending on where you are camping. I was in a park. I don't know about 3 persons but 1 is comfortable for sure - 2 may be a bit tight. I was a newbie camper and I was able to get it up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Judith M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fits two people with gear very comfortably, three is a little more "cozy" but doable
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have gone camping in Louisiana many times with this tent. Fits two people with gear very comfortably, three is a little more "cozy" but doable. It's really quick and easy to set up and break down. I wish there were bigger/more windows, but it's not a big deal. Still love this little tent, lots of great camping memories.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Its nice
customer_reviews.text: it nice.. we used 1 time for camping it's not my thing.. but the tent was nice.. were big people and we both fit in nicely with dog
customer_reviews.author: T. Bright

customer_reviews.title: great tent, i was only able to set it ...
customer_reviews.text: great tent, i was only able to set it up indoors until spring. very well made. i needed help setting it up but it is the first dome tent i have set up. i am hoping after a few times i can do it alone. i usually go camping alone on my scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: We enjoyed the size
customer_reviews.text: Leaked our first night using it, which consisted of a light rain. Kind of a big deal-breaker. Otherwise, could have been a decent tent for the price. We enjoyed the size, easy setup and breakdown, and little features like the rain-fly and extra little piece outside the door to keep shoes. And believe it or not- DOES successfully accommodate a 6'7" man and compact girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this tent
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my youngest for Christmas. She loves to 'camp' outdoors or inside. Nice amount of space (fits her and two adults easy) and it seems to breathe fine so long as we intermittently crack a window. The quality is great for this price! It's taken a breating already with zero problems. Zippers are fantastic too!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star Seller, Product- 2 stars: Too small of a tent; nothing to do with seller product came quickly and everything was intact
customer_reviews.text: Way too small of a tent. Couldn't possibly fit three (adult) people unless they were children. I would say that I am average size, 5 6', size 12 women and it was way too small. Wish I could still return, didn't even sleep in it.
customer_reviews.author: New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice tent. It's easy to assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tent. It's easy to assembly. It will fit three people. There was a small piece missing from my tent. I called Wenzel. They immediately got the piece to me. The assistant was more than happy to assist me. There was absolutely no hassle. This is a fine company to order your tent. I will most definitely order from Wenzel again.
customer_reviews.author: Sisterannie

customer_reviews.title: Backyard tent
customer_reviews.text: We have this tent in our backyard. The kids play and sometimes eat in there. They love it! It's easy to clean, easy to put up, easy to move... It fits 2 adults. I wouldn't recommend more than that for comfort. When the kids play, 5 of them in the tent are fine.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: As it seems easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: As it seems easy to setup, it's really not!!! I camp a lot and I have setup many tents, this tent take a lot of man power to get to going.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Madrid

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my fiancees first camping trip (I prefer my hammock). It ended up being a great little tent. The 1st night we slept on the tent floor with no air mattress a ND the 2nd we stuffed a double height queen size one in there. It was pretty cramped with that air mattress but if you had a thinner one you'd be fine. We got a some rain too and it held up really well to the weather, no leaks or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Zafoot

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used the tent once. My fiancee and I went camping in early march. I will first say that it is def only for two people. W/our clothing bags and us there isnt room for anything else. Love having the extra pockets to put our things like cell phones or a bottle water in the night. It got very wet inside at night because it was cold outside. I love the place to put our shoes and love that the windows and door face the same direction so we can face the water and not worry about people driving by and seeing in our tent. Def a value for your dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Elder Clan

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Uhm....ever hear of air circulation in a tent? I guess not. Don't waste your money. The air just hangs in this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Azzurri

customer_reviews.title: Easily assembled
customer_reviews.text: Great tent overall. Experienced a light rain and everything stayed dry inside.
customer_reviews.author: Hkmincer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: So awesome to get back out in the wilderness thanks to this handy tent to sleep in!
customer_reviews.author: James A Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Awful setup
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awful. I've been camping since I was a child, and have always been able to set up my tent by myself in 15 minutes or less. The poles on this one are almost impossible to get into the little slots; it's a two person job and 10 minutes a pole. I keep setting it up hoping the fabric will stretch a little, but so far, no luck.
customer_reviews.author: firefly

customer_reviews.title: Wenzel Alpine Tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for camping purposes, its easy to assemble for a first timer like myself. The tent is sturdy to hold during strong winds and waterproof for stormy nights. For the price, you are getting a well constructed, reliable tent. You can't possibly go wrong with this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Meza-Alonso

customer_reviews.title: A Scout said it's a good tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was purchased on sBoy Scout camping activity. The Scout using it said it's a great tent, roomy and easy to set up. More to follow as the tent is in use this weekend!
customer_reviews.author: Rob W

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tent. It took me about 20-30 minutes to get it set up, but that's because I had no help and getting the rods where they needed to be was a little challenging as one person. Two people could have this up in 5-10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: Great tent except for the bullet holes. Those were my fault so still a great tent. A bit small for 3 people
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Odd lay out
customer_reviews.text: The interior shape is pretty odd on the inside, but I gave it 3 starts because it survived burningman. (all through the fly trap was grabage and the dust storm on wednesday send alllll the dust right in through the flaps.)
customer_reviews.author: Karissa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Poles showed up broken w/ internal cords all cut, but customer service was great!
customer_reviews.text: This tent showed up with the internal bungee-cords on all the tent poles cut/broken... I stupidly didn't check out the tent until after the Amazon 30 day return period, but NO PROBLEM! I called the Wenzel customer service number included with the tent. In less than a minute I was speaking to a gentleman named Pat, and in less than 10 minutes a new set of poles was being overnighted to me. That was monday, and today (wednesday) there's a box with a new set of poles waiting for me when I get home from work!
customer_reviews.author: Hugh W.

customer_reviews.title: First Time Camper
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my son's Cub Scout Overnighter. It was simple to set up and break down. It rained during the camp out and the rain stayed out of the tent, and i didn't seal it. I was a little concerned about the cover on the top because it seemed so small compared to the other campers who had covers that were way bigger, but again, the rain stayed out and that is what matters! I did purchase heavy duty stakes and used those instead of the stakes that came with the tent which were fairly thin. Overall, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lamont Clark

customer_reviews.title: Well designed at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Decent tent for the price. Eazy to set up and roomy. Like second/separate top that help maintain comfortable temperature inside as well an dry.
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1, Okay for 2, Small for 3
customer_reviews.text: Two would fit assuming they are okay with being rather close to each other. I purchase the tent for solo use and I was very happy with the size for 1 person. Assuming two adults were in here with their bags and all the other stuff they might prefer to keep inside the tent I am very certain 3 adults would never work.
customer_reviews.author: Kace

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 2-man tent for backpacking or emergency preparedness
customer_reviews.text: Awesome 2-man tent for backpacking or emergency preparedness. It seems very well made, is light and compact. I was able to fit the tent(inside it's carrying case), collapsible cookware and my solo stove into 1 large tactile mole bag!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small tent.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Wyoming and in the spring time there is some major wind. This little guy has stood up to 50+ mph wind while other tents around me collapsed. It can be difficult to set up for sure, but the pay off is a seriously durable tent. It is light weight and fits in the bag easily (very rare for tents). It fits a queen air mattress comfortably and keeps decently warm in colder weather.. Overall this tent has been one of the best tents I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: I'd say this is a perfect one person tent though
customer_reviews.text: because of the unique shape of this tent, the inside doesn't have as much room as you'd think. I'd say this is a perfect one person tent though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Good tent for the price. I bought it a year ago for my daughter to play with outdoors. I set it up outside almost a year ago next month. She loves it. And it is not faded or torn anywhere but where one of her friends ran through the door when it was closed. However, That is to be expected if you rough house something. So for me to have it outside for a year set up and it is still in great shape I would give it a great thumps up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect buy - -
customer_reviews.text: Perfect - Everything explained was as expected. The tent does really have room for 3 although I purchased it for 2, thus giving us room to place several items inside the tent with us. It was a very winding camping weekend, and the tent stood its ground - no flapping at any point of the sides, nor did any hooks come loose. Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: alexios argyris

customer_reviews.title: This inexpensive tent REALLY Surprised me!
customer_reviews.text: You don't often find low cost equipment that you expect to perform really well or last very long. I was really proven wrong with this tent! This has turned out to be a GREAT buy for the price. I've had tents that cost twice what this one cost that I wasn't as happy with.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sellars

customer_reviews.title: Alpine Tent
customer_reviews.text: I've been watching this item for quite a while. The features and appearance kept my attention since my first review. Sale price prompted purchase. I trust it will function and perform as marketed.
customer_reviews.author: RLT-TEXAS

customer_reviews.title: It is overall a great tent,and roomy on the inside.Very happy!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this tent!!! It can hold up in the rain and strong wind!!!
customer_reviews.author: lyricray716

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: SPACIOUS-- for a small tent. Easy to put up and down. held up in light rain. Fit 2 adults, 1 kid, an a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky plum

customer_reviews.title: great tent
customer_reviews.text: this tent was easy to set up and large enough for my boyfriend and myself (we had intended to have our dog along and he would have fit too)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

product_meta.title: Wenzel Alpine 3 Person Tent
product_meta.description:
Lightweight, easy to set up and take down, the Wenzel Alpine 3-pole pentadome tent is a great choice for a camping adventure. It features a single room that measures 8 by 8.5 feet with the third pole creating a vestibule, giving an area for storing gear and weather protection. It will sleep up to 3 people. This tent has a D-style door with mesh window, and closeable mesh windows for great cross ventilation. A gear loft and hanging gear pocket are included as well as an integrated mud mat with a drainage strip. The shockcorded fiberglass frame and pole pockets make set up quick. The Weather Armor polyester with a polyurethane coating protects from top to bottom while the sonic sealed polyethylene tub-style floor combats water seepage. Seams are Double-stitched, lap-felled to provide a shingle effect against water and all threads, zippers and webbing are treated with superior water repellency applications. Duffle bag is included for storage. Specifications: • Base: 8.5 ft. x 8 ft. • Center Height: 48 in. • Area: 49 sq. ft. (vestibule 7 sq. ft.) • Door: Dutch "D" style • Floor: welded polyethylene • Frame: fiberglass • Stakes: steel • Carry Weight: 8 lbs • Sleeps: 3

AMAZON.COM
Lightweight, easy to set up, and versatile, the Wenzel Alpine three-person dome tent is a great choice for all types of camping and conditions. The Alpine includes such features as a three-pole pentadome design that creates a vestibule for gear storage and weather protection, a shock-corded fiberglass frame (with pole pockets) that sets up and disassembles quickly, and an integrated mud mat with a drainage strip to keep the tent clean. Campers will also appreciate the Weather Armor polyester fabric and sonic-sealed polyethylene tub-style floor, which are reliably rugged and resist leaks of all kinds. The closeable mesh windows and D-style front door, meanwhile, do a nice job of ventilating the tent and controlling morning moisture. Additional details include double-stitched seams, a gear loft for smaller items, a hanging pocket, and a duffel bag for storage. 

 Specifications

 * Base: 8.5 by 8 feet 
 * Center height: 48 inches 
 * Interior space: 49 square feet 
 * Sleeps: 3 
 * Windows 2 
 * Door: Dutch D-style 
 * Floor: Welded polyethylene 
 * Frame: Fiberglass 
 * Carrying weight: 8 pounds 

 Amazon.com Tent Guide 
Selecting a Tent
Fortunately, there are all kinds of tents for weekend car campers, Everest expeditions, and everything in-between. Here are a few things to keep in mind: 

 Expect the Worst
In general, it's wise to choose a tent that's designed to withstand the worst possible conditions you think you'll face. For instance, if you're a summer car camper in a region where weather is predictable, an inexpensive family or all-purpose tent will likely do the trick--especially if a vehicle is nearby and you can make a mad dash for safety when bad weather swoops in. If you're a backpacker, alpine climber, or bike explorer, or if you like to car camp in all seasons, you'll want to buy something designed to handle more adversity. 

 Three- and Four-Season Tents
For summer, early fall, and late spring outings, choose a three-season tent. At minimum, a quality three-season tent will have lightweight aluminum poles, a reinforced floor, durable stitching, and a quality rain fly. Some three-season tents offer more open-air netting and are specifically designed for summer backpacking or other activities. Many premium tents will also feature pre-sealed, taped seams and a silicone-impregnated rain fly for enhanced waterproofing. 

 For winter camping or alpine travel, go with a four-season model. Because they typically feature more durable fabric coatings, as well as more poles, four-season tents are designed to handle heavy snowfall and high winds without collapsing. Of course, four-season tents exact a weight penalty of about 10 to 20 percent in trade for their strength and durability. They also tend to be more expensive. 

 Domes and Tunnels
Tents are broadly categorized into two types: freestanding, which can stand up on their own, and tents that must be staked down in order to stand upright. Freestanding tents often incorporate a dome-shaped design, and most four-season tents are constructed this way because a dome leaves no flat spots on the outer surface where snow can collect. Domes are also inherently stronger than any other design. Meanwhile, many three-season models employ a modified dome configuration called a tunnel. These are still freestanding, but they require fewer poles than a dome, use less fabric, and typically have a rectangular floorplan that offers less storage space than a dome configuration. Many one and two-person tents are not freestanding, but they make up for it by being lighter. Because they use fewer poles, they can also be quicker to set up than a dome. 

 Size Matters
Ask yourself how many people you'd like to fit in your fabric hotel now and in the future. For soloists and minimalists, check out one-person tents. If you're a mega-minimalist, or if you have your eye on doing some big wall climbs, a waterproof-breathable bivy sack is the ticket. Some bivy sacks feature poles and stake points to give you a little more breathing room. Also, if you don't need bug protection and you want to save weight, check out open-air shelters. 

 Families who plan on car camping in good weather can choose from a wide range of jumbo-sized tents that will accommodate all your little ones with room to spare. A wide range of capacities is available for three- and four-season backpacking and expedition tents. Remember, though, the bigger the tent you buy, the heavier it will be, although it's easy to break up the tent components among several people in your group. It's also helpful to compare the volume and floor-space measurements of models you're considering.
feature_bullets: Shock-corded fiberglass frame for quick and easy setup
Integrated mud mat with drainage strip to keep tent clean
2 mesh windows and D-style front door for ventilation
Measures 8.5 x 4 x 8 feet (W x H x D); weighs 8 pounds
